174.title: BMW Group to invest $1.7 billion to produce EVs in US
174.article_body: The BMW Group will invest $1.7 billion to produce EVs in the US. The investment of $1 billion will be used to prepare for producing EVs at the company's existing manufacturing facility in South Carolina and $700 million will be used to build a battery assembly facility. The German automaker partnered with Envision AESC, which will produce lithium-ion battery cells.

175.title: Gurugram man cheated of ₹1 cr on pretext of mutual fund investments
175.article_body: A couple has been booked for allegedly cheating an 83-year-old man of over ₹1 crore on pretext of investing in mutual funds in Gurugram, police said. The man is a retired Lok Sabha staffer. "The complainant had managed to recover over ₹30 lakh by writing to firms where his money had been invested with forged documents," a police officer said.

176.title: Russian court orders arrest of journalist who protested war on live TV
176.article_body: A Russian court has ordered the arrest of journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who protested against the Russian invasion of Ukraine during an on-air news bulletin, Interfax reported. Ovsyannikova's lawyer earlier said that she fled Russia after refusing to be under house arrest. The journalist was accused of spreading fake news about Russian armed forces during one-person protest near the Kremlin.

177.title: PM Modi lays foundation stone of connectivity projects worth ₹3,400 cr in Uttarakhand
177.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday laid the foundation stone of various connectivity projects worth over ₹3,400 crore at Mana village in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district. The projects unveiled by the PM include two new ropeway projects connecting Gaurikund to Kedarnath and Govindghat to Hemkund Sahib. "For me, every village on the border is the first village in India," PM added.

178.title: SC dismisses plea seeking opening of 22 rooms of Taj Mahal
178.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea seeking the "opening of 22 rooms" on the premises of the Taj Mahal and a "fact-finding inquiry" into the monument's history. The petition was earlier dismissed by Allahabad High Court. "The high court was not in error in dismissing the petition, which is more of a publicity interest litigation," the SC said.

179.title: 3-year-old shoots and kills 15-month-old baby in US; probe on
179.article_body: A 15-month-old baby has died after being shot in the face by a three-year-old in the US state of Pennsylvania on Tuesday. The victim's grandfather told local media that the three-year-old was a relative. The Lancaster Bureau of Police is investigating the incident and said that adults were being questioned. No arrests have been made so far.

180.title: Missing food delivery executive found dead in nullah in Pune
180.article_body: A food delivery executive who went missing on October 17 was found dead on Friday in a nullah in Pune, police said. The deceased's brother claimed that it was raining heavily when his brother went to deliver food and added, "We suspect he might've got washed away in...rainwater." A probe is on to ascertain cause of death, an inspector said.

181.title: Girl gets paper re-checked, beats twin sister to become Class 12 UP board exam topper
181.article_body: Divya from Fatehpur district has become the new topper of Class 12 Uttar Pradesh board exam, taking away the top spot from her twin sister Divyanshi who scored 477/500. Divya, who scored 56 marks in Hindi, had applied for re-evaluation of the paper, following which the marks rose to 94, District Inspector of Schools said. Divya has scored 479/500.

182.title: ED seizes jewellery worth ₹149 cr during raids in Hyderabad, Vijayawada
182.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has seized jewellery stocks worth more than ₹149 crore during recent raids at five locations in Hyderabad and Vijayawada. The raids were conducted in a case related to alleged cheating with MMTC, a public sector enterprise. The search operations were conducted at MBS Jewellers Pvt Ltd and Musaddilal Gems and Jewels India Pvt Ltd.

183.title: List of 10 all time best Indian films released
183.article_body: The India chapter of the International Federation of Film Critics (FIPRESCI) has released a list of the top 10 films in the history of Indian cinema. Satyajit Ray's Pather Panchali topped the list followed by 1960 drama Meghe Dhaka Tara, Bhuvan Shome (1969), Malayalam film Elippathayam (1981), Ghatashraddha (1977) and Garm Hava (1973). Sholay has been ranked 10th by FIPRESCI.

184.title: Fraudster arrested for cheating Mumbai investor of ₹12 lakh
184.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 38-year-old fraudster from Tamil Nadu for allegedly cheating a man of ₹12 lakh on the pretext of high returns on diamond trading investment. The police has seized at least five crypto wallets in which cryptocurrency worth lakhs of rupees was kept. It has also confiscated 119 mobile phones used by the accused.

185.title: At least 150 people killed in 2 days of fighting in Sudan
185.article_body: At least 150 people have reportedly been killed in ethnic clashes in the last two days in Sudan's Blue Nile state. The violence broke out last week between rival ethnic groups following a land dispute in which more than a dozen people were killed. Sudan has been grappling with political unrest and violence since last year's military coup.

186.title: Priyanka Gandhi to hold 8 rallies, roadshows in Himachal Pradesh
186.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh polls, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi will hold eight rallies and roadshows in the state until November 10. She will start her campaign from Mandi and Kullu on October 31 before visiting Kangra and Chamba on November 3. The state will go to polls on November 12 and the votes will be counted on December 8.

187.title: Youths who pelted stones in J&K now becoming sarpanches: Amit Shah
187.article_body: On the occasion of Police Commemoration Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that youths who pelted stones in Jammu and Kashmir are now becoming panches and sarpanches. "Earlier, armed forces were given special power, now youth is given special power for their progress," he added. Most hotspots in the country are "almost free" from anti-national activities, he further said.

188.title: Sachin Tendulkar forays into NFTs as a strategic investor in Rario
188.article_body: Rario, a licensed digital cricket collectibles platform, announced that Sachin Tendulkar has invested in and partnered with the company for his exclusive NFTs/digital collectibles. Rario stated that it has already exclusively partnered with Aaron Finch, Quinton de Kock, Shakib Al Hasan, Rishabh Pant, Virender Sehwag, Zaheer Khan, Smriti Mandhana, Cricket Australia, New Zealand Cricket among others.

189.title: Muslims can never trust people who worship Godse: SP MLA Mehmood
189.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Iqbal Mehmood on Thursday claimed that Muslims can never vote for BJP as they can "never trust people who worship Godse, the killer of Mahatma Gandhi". He also alleged that the AIMIM, which is led by Asaduddin Owaisi, is BJP's "B team". "A true Muslim can never vote for BJP," he further said.

190.title: Video shows bus on fire in Andhra; passengers lose cash, jewellery
190.article_body: A bus carrying about 60 passengers was gutted in fire in Andhra Pradesh on Friday, a video of which has surfaced. No passengers were hurt in the incident, however, many lost their belongings, including cash, gold jewellery and other valuables. The fire reportedly started in the engine. The driver noticed the smoke and evacuated the bus before it was engulfed.

191.title: Virat Kohli asks fans to not speak while he is practising, video goes viral
191.article_body: A video went viral showing Virat Kohli telling fans not to speak while he was practising in the nets. In the video, a fan can be heard shouting "Out of the stadium" after Kohli hit a ball. After that, Kohli said, "Please don't speak while I'm practising...It's very distracting." The fans can then be heard telling Kohli they won't speak.

192.title: Diwali to be a public school holiday in New York City schools from 2023
192.article_body: Diwali will be a public school holiday in New York City starting next year. Mayor Eric Adams announced plans to include the holiday in the public school schedule on Thursday. "We're going to have children start talking about what it is to celebrate the Festival of Lights, and how do you turn a light on within yourself," Adams said.

193.title: World War 3 very unlikely, it's the closest we have been since 1962: Elon Musk
193.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said the World War 3 is "still very unlikely" to happen. In response to a Twitter user's query on the likelihood of a world war, Musk wrote that this is the closest the world has been since 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis. "It...would be nice to have one year without a horrible global event," he added.

194.title: Policeman steals gold ornaments from friend's house in Kerala
194.article_body: A policeman has been arrested for allegedly stealing eight sovereigns of gold ornaments from his friend's house in Kerala's Ernakulam district. The police suspect that online rummy gaming led the accused, 35-year-old Amal Dev, to indulge in theft. "He was a regular visitor to his friend's house...The investigation on the visitors of the house led to him," said police.

195.title: 2-time champions West Indies crash out of T20 World Cup 2022
195.article_body: Two-time champions West Indies crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022 after losing their Group B first round match against Ireland on Friday. Ireland restricted West Indies to 146/5 in 20 overs before chasing down the target in 17.3 overs. Ireland have qualified for the Super 12 stage by winning two out of three matches in the first round.

196.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted Noida woman, garlanded after release
196.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting a woman in Noida, was garlanded after his release from jail. A video surfaced online in which his supporters can be seen showering flowers on him and shouting "Shrikant bhaiya zindabad". "One of our sisters was put forward...attempt was made to finish me politically by staging a dispute between us," Tyagi said.

197.title: Govt eyeing $7.7 billion valuation for IDBI Bank stake sale: Report
197.article_body: The government is pushing for a valuation of nearly $7.7 billion for IDBI Bank, which could be the biggest sale of the government's stake in a lender in decades, Bloomberg quoted a source as saying. The regulatory approvals and security clearances could be reportedly given to bidders after November. IDBI Bank's market value was about $5.8 billion as of Thursday.

198.title: Musk & Twitter's advisers prepare to close deal by Oct end: Report
198.article_body: Elon Musk and Twitter's advisers are preparing paperwork to complete the $44 billion takeover deal by October 28, Bloomberg reported. Talks between SpaceX CEO and the social media platform have reportedly turned cordial after months of accusations, with focus on closing the transaction. The Wall Street banks are working on steps to finalise funding about $13 billion of debt commitments.

199.title: Putin critic Navalny says he faces new criminal case, up to 30 yrs in jail
199.article_body: Jailed Russian opposition politician Alexey Navalny on Thursday said that Russian authorities have opened a new criminal case against him for "promoting terrorism and extremism" that could potentially more than double his current prison sentence. The 46-year-old critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin is currently serving more than 11 years for fraud, contempt of court and parole violations.

200.title: Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh
200.article_body: An Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday, according to reports. The site of accident is not connected by road and a rescue team has been sent, Defence PRO, Guwahati, said. Earlier this month, a MiG-29K fighter aircraft crashed during a routine sortie over sea off Goa coast after it developed a technical malfunction while returning to base.

201.title: Why has Google been fined ₹1,337.76 crore by the CCI?
201.article_body: The CCI has imposed ₹1,337.76 crore fine on Google for abusing its dominant position in multiple markets in Android mobile device ecosystem. Google imposes "unfair condition" on device makers by requiring them to preinstall its apps, the CCI said. It added that Google abused its dominant position in search, app stores, web browsers and video services to squeeze out competitors.

202.title: Google sued by Texas for allegedly collecting biometric data without consent
202.article_body: US state of Texas has filed a lawsuit against Google for allegedly collecting biometric data of millions of Texans, since 2015, without prior consent. Google used people's faces and voices through Google Photos, Google Assistant, and Nest Hub Max, the complaint said. Google said it will fight the case, adding that users had option to turn off biometric collection feature.

203.title: Girl allegedly gets poked in an eye with pencil at Punjab school, loses sight
203.article_body: A six-year-old girl's parents staged a protest outside a school in Punjab's Ludhiana after a classmate allegedly poked her in the eye with a pencil causing her to lose sight in one eye. The parents claimed that the school misled them about the cause of the injury and sent their daughter home instead of rushing her to a hospital.

204.title: Shah pays tribute at police memorial, says their sacrifice will be remembered
204.article_body: On the occasion of Police Commemoration Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah paid tribute to police personnel, who lost their lives in the line of duty, at the National Police Memorial. He said that their sacrifice would always be remembered. The day is observed every year in memory of the 10 policemen killed by Chinese troops in 1959.

205.title: Delhivery's stock hits record low after falling below IPO price
205.article_body: Shares of logistics company Delhivery fell by nearly 18% on Friday to ₹382.25 as it expected moderate growth of shipment volumes for the rest of FY23. The Gurugram-based company's stock is now below its IPO price of ₹487/share, which is a record low since it was listed on the bourses earlier this year. On Thursday, its shares plunged by 17.07%.

206.title: IAS officer Narain gets transit anticipatory bail in alleged rape case
206.article_body: Delhi HC granted transit anticipatory bail till October 28 to senior IAS officer Jitendra Narain for his alleged involvement in a rape case. "It wouldn't be appropriate to consider the allegations and counter allegations at this stage as it may prejudice the case of either party," HC said. Narain is accused of raping a woman in Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

207.title: Gurugram Police book banker & wife for cheating retired officer of ₹1 crore
207.article_body: The Gurugram Police booked a couple for allegedly cheating a retired central government officer of ₹1 crore on the pretext of investing his money in the share market. According to police, the prime suspect worked at a private bank while his wife was a sub-broker with an investment firm. The accused confessed to losing ₹1 crore in betting.

208.title: Important that UK finds stability as soon as possible: French Prez
208.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said it was important that Britain found "stability as soon as possible" amid the resignation of British Prime Minister Liz Truss. "On a personal level, I am always sad to see a colleague go," he added. Liz Truss resigned as UK Prime Minister on Thursday after 45 days in office amid a massive economic crisis.

209.title: Governor seeks report on sexual assault of 4-yr-old girl in Hyd
209.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan has sought a report from the state government on the alleged sexual assault of a four-year-old girl, an LKG student, at Hyderabad's DAV Public School by the principal's driver. Soundararajan called for immediate action against the perpetrator. The driver was arrested on Tuesday, while the principal was arrested for negligence a day later.

210.title: Harsha Bhogle names his all-time T20 World Cup XI; includes 1 Indian, 2 Pakistani players
210.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle has named his all-time T20 World Cup XI. Virat Kohli features as the only Indian, and Shahid Afridi and Umar Gul features as two Pakistani cricketers in his XI. He named Chris Gayle and Jos Buttler as the openers. Other players include Kevin Pietersen, Michael Hussey, Shane Watson, Lasith Malinga, Trent Bould and Samuel Badree.

211.title: India can't dictate how Pakistan will play cricket: Wasim Akram
211.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah saying India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 and will look for a neutral venue, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "India can’t dictate how Pakistan will play cricket." He added, "If Shah had to say something...he should've called PCB chief Ramiz Raja. There should have been a meeting of Asian Cricket Council."

212.title: Woman slaps guard, pulls female guard's hair as fight breaks out at Noida society
212.article_body: A woman was seen slapping a guard and pulling a female guard's hair after a fight broke out between two groups of residents at a society in Noida. The fight started at the Hyde Park society in Sector 78 over a residents' body election. Security guards were accused of manipulating the election and helping one of the groups.

213.title: Pic of close up of ant's face wins photography competition; people call it 'horrifying'
213.article_body: A picture of an ant's face, magnified five times under a microscope, has won the 2022 Nikon Small World Photomicrography Competition. Reacting to the picture by Lithuanian photographer Eugenijus Kavaliauskas, social media users wrote, "Horrifying," and, "Is this an alien?" Reacting to the comments, the photographer said, "There are no horrors in nature."

214.title: Earlier govts made fun of tribal traditions, we respect them: PM
214.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday laid the foundation stone of multiple development initiatives worth over ₹1,970 crore in Gujarat's Tapi and said that there are political parties who've a history of making false promises, however, BJP has always given priority to tribal welfare. "While earlier governments made fun of tribal traditions, we on the other hand respect...tribal traditions," he added.

215.title: 3 die of asphyxiation while cleaning drain at Pune residential society
215.article_body: At least three workers died of asphyxiation while cleaning a drain at a residential society in Pune's Wagholi area on Friday morning, a fire brigade official said. The victims entered the drain around 6 am and local residents informed the police and the fire brigade when they noticed that they were not responding around 7 am.

216.title: Chahal's wife Dhanashree trolls Urvashi with 'My heart led me to Australia' post
216.article_body: While going to join husband Yuzvendra Chahal for the T20 World Cup, choreographer Dhanashree trolled actress Urvashi Rautela in an Instagram post. Sharing a picture from a plane, Dhanashree wrote, "My [heart] led me to Australia, literally. Got to be there for my man." Earlier, Urvashi shared a flight selfie and wrote, "Followed my [heart]...it led me to Australia."

217.title: BJP responsible for garbage mountains in Delhi: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj
217.article_body: After Union Home Minister Amit Shah accused AAP of step-motherly treatment towards the three municipal corporations in Delhi, AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj claimed that the BJP is responsible for garbage mountains in the national capital. "The BJP-led MCD was tasked with managing waste but still Delhi is categorised as one of the most unsanitary cities in our country," said Bharadwaj.

218.title: $40 bn wiped off digital ad firms' m-cap after Snap's revenue warning
218.article_body: After Snapchat-parent Snap on Thursday warned that it would see no revenue growth in the holiday quarter, shares of digital ad companies, including Meta and Google-owner Alphabet dropped by 4% and 2%, respectively. Snap's stock fell by 25%, while Pinterest's declined nearly 8%. The sell-off erased over $40 billion in market value from these firms and other internet ad companies.

219.title: Harry Potter-themed coins released in UK to celebrate 25 years of the series
219.article_body: The Royal Mint, which makes all the coins in the United Kingdom, has released Harry Potter-themed 50p coins to celebrate 25th anniversary of the publication of 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' by JK Rowling in 1997. Royal Mint designer Ffion Gwillim, who modelled the artwork onto coins, said, "The Harry Potter illustrations are so iconic and recognisable."

220.title: IIT graduates' GlobalFair raises $20 mn in Series A funding round
220.article_body: GlobalFair, a B2B building material supplier started by two IIT graduates, Shaily Garg and Ashish Chandra, has secured $20 million in Series A funding round through equity and debt. Lightspeed Venture Partners led the funding round, which also saw participation from Saama Capital, Stride Ventures, India Quotient, and AUM Ventures.

221.title: Doctor, wife die by electrocution from geyser at Hyderabad apartment
221.article_body: A 26-year-old doctor and his 22-year-old wife reportedly died by electrocution from the geyser at their apartment in Hyderabad. The woman's father found the bodies of the couple in the bathroom. The police suspect that the woman suffered electric shock from the geyser first and her husband got electrocuted while trying to save her.

222.title: U'khand HC asks SIT to file status report in Ankita Bhandari murder case
222.article_body: Uttarakhand High Court on Thursday directed the Special Investigation Team (SIT) investigating the Ankita Bhandari murder case to file a status report along with the case diary. HC fixed November 3 as the date for the next hearing. This comes after a plea was filed by a resident of Pauri Garhwal seeking that the probe is handed over to CBI.

223.title: Jaffer lists T20 World Cup teams' weaknesses, trolls England for not having a PM
223.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to list T20 World Cup 2022 teams' weaknesses. He wrote, "India don't have a 150 kmph+ bowler. Pakistan don't have a seasoned finisher. New Zealand don't have great record in Australia. Sri Lanka don't have an experienced squad." Trolling England over the current political situation, he joked, "England don't have a Prime Minister."

224.title: I'm shaking, won't recover for another week: Kangana after watching 'Kantara'
224.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she was "shaking" after watching 'Kantara'. "What an explosive experience. Rishab Shetty, hats off to you...I heard so many people in the theatre say that they had never seen anything like this. Thank you for this film. I don't think I will recover from this experience for another week," she added.

225.title: CRPF constable rapes woman on pretext of marriage in Delhi; held
225.article_body: A CRPF constable was arrested for allegedly raping a woman multiple times in Delhi, police said on Thursday. The woman had filed a complaint against the accused claiming that he raped her on the pretext of marriage, according to police. Both the accused and complainant are in process of getting separated from their respective spouses, an officer said.

226.title: Major Mumbai roads, traffic islands to be illuminated between Oct 22-29
226.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to illuminate major public places, roads, traffic islands and other places in Mumbai between October 22 and 29, reports said. "Funds for these works have been classified as incidental expenditure to each ward office. Therefore, immediate action should be taken by calling for spot tenders," a BMC release said.

227.title: US diplomat's wife pleads guilty over UK car crash that killed teen
227.article_body: Anne Sacoolas, the wife of an American diplomat, pleaded guilty on Thursday to causing the death of a teenager by driving carelessly in England in August 2019. The 19-year-old, Harry Dunn, was killed when his motorcycle was hit by Sacoolas' car near a US military base in Northamptonshire. Following the incident, Sacoolas fled the UK under diplomatic immunity.

228.title: Liz Truss entitled to ₹1 crore/year for life despite only serving 45 days as UK PM
228.article_body: Liz Truss is entitled to £115,000 (over ₹1 crore) per year for the rest of her life as a former Prime Minister, despite only being in office for 45 days. Truss, who became the shortest-serving leader in British history, resigned amid massive economic crisis. She had defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race.

229.title: Student ends life over fear of not getting job placement in Pune
229.article_body: A 22-year-old student allegedly died by suicide on Thursday over the fear of not being able to get a job placement in Pune. The deceased, who was studying design at a college in the city, was under immense pressure for the past few days, police said. The police have not revealed whether a suicide note was recovered from the deceased.

230.title: Over 7,000 unrecognised madrasas found in UP survey so far
230.article_body: Over 7,000 unrecognised madrasas have been found in Uttar Pradesh so far in the ongoing survey by the government, said UP Madarsa Education Board Chairman Iftikhar Ahmed Javed. "The number of these [unrecognised] madrasas is expected to go up as information is still pouring in," he added. "After the survey, we are going to clean the system," he further said.

231.title: Instagram update lets users block all existing accounts of a person
231.article_body: Instagram has made an update that allows users to block all existing accounts of a person. Last year, the social media platform gave users the ability to block a person from contacting them through any new accounts that they may create. Additionally, the platform said its 'Hidden Words' feature will now also support more languages including Russian, Bengali and Tamil.

232.title: SC grants interim bail to accused in 2017 Gurugram school murder case
232.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday granted interim bail to the accused in the 2017 Gurugram school murder case in which the then 16-year-old had murdered his seven-year-old junior, Pradyuman Thakur. The Juvenile Justice Board on Monday ruled that the accused student should be tried as an adult and not as a juvenile. The accused has been in detention for five years.

233.title: PM offers prayers at Kedarnath Temple, wears 'Chola Dora' made by women of Chamba
233.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday offered prayers at Kedarnath Temple ahead of laying the foundation stone of Kedarnath Ropeway Project. PM Modi wore a traditional outfit popularly known as 'Chola Dora', which was made by women of Chamba. It was gifted to PM Modi during his recent visit to Himachal Pradesh.

234.title: HCL Founder Shiv Nadar donated ₹3 crore per day over the last year: Hurun
234.article_body: Shiv Nadar, the billionaire Founder and Chairman Emeritus of HCL Technologies, donated ₹3 crore per day over the last year, according to EdelGive Hurun India Philanthropy List 2022. The 77-year-old industrialist reclaimed the title of being 'India's Most Generous', topping the philanthropy list with a yearly donation of ₹1,161 crore. The primary cause of his philanthropy is arts and culture.

235.title: Chidambaram suggests PM meet with 5 professionals over falling rupee
235.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram has claimed that the government seems "helpless against the relentless" rupee depreciation. He suggested that PM Narendra Modi should hold a closed-door meeting with five "eminent professionals", including former RBI Governors, C Rangarajan, Y V Reddy and Raghuram Rajan, over the matter. BJP leader Amit Malviya criticised the suggestion, calling it "unsolicited" advice.

236.title: India reports 2,119 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 25,037
236.article_body: India reported 2,119 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,141 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 25,037. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,953 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

237.title: Russia turning Ukraine power grid into new battleground: Zelenskyy
237.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday told European Union that "Russia's leadership has given the order to turn the energy system itself into a battlefield". The Russian strikes are "aimed at creating as many electricity and heat problems as possible for Ukraine this fall and winter and for as many Ukrainians as possible to go to your countries", he added.

238.title: Permira appoints ex-Warburg exec Siddharth Narayan as India head
238.article_body: UK-based global private equity firm Permira has appointed Siddharth Narayan as its India head, based in Mumbai. Prior to joining Permira, Narayan worked at American PE firm Warburg Pincus. He had also been associated with Lightspeed Venture Partners and McKinsey & Company. He holds an MBA from The Wharton School and is an alumnus of Indian Institute of Technology, Madras.

239.title: Make this Diwali a happy and healthy Diwali: Oleev
239.article_body: Oleev shared that since cooking oil used in food matters as much as the ingredients, one must make a conscious choice in choosing it, especially during the festive season. Oleev Active is a multisource oil with the goodness of olive oil for Indian cooking, it stated, encouraging customers to choose health, good habits and a proactive lifestyle this Diwali.

240.title: Don't follow rumours, wait for facts: Twitter on report of Musk firing 75% staff
240.article_body: Twitter's top lawyer told employees not to follow "rumours or leaked documents but rather wait for facts", after a report claimed that Elon Musk plans to lay off 75% of the company's entire workforce. Twitter doesn't have any confirmation of Musk's plans following the close of the deal, the company's top lawyer said, warning employees of "public rumours and speculation".

241.title: Illegal online horse betting racket busted in Hyderabad; 2 arrested
241.article_body: An illegal horse betting racket being run through WhatsApp was busted in Hyderabad, said police. Two suspects, a 45-year-old bookie and a 23-year-old accountant, were arrested. According to police, the accused ran the operation through a WhatsApp group named Turf Line and used to collect money through online apps PhonePe and Google Pay.

242.title: Sensex, Nifty gain on last trading day of Samvat 2078
242.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on the last trading day of Samvat 2078 with the Sensex gaining 300 points and the Nifty above 17,600 points. Axis Bank, M&M, Titan Company, SBI Life Insurance and HDFC Life were among the major gainers on Nifty. The stocks of Bajaj Finance, TCS, Tech Mahindra, Power Grid Corporation and Divi's Labs slipped.

243.title: You can't have Bumrah breaking down 10 days before the World Cup: Roger Binny
243.article_body: BCCI President Roger Binny said that the cricket board needs to address why and how players are breaking down "so easily". "You can't have Jasprit Bumrah breaking down 10 days before the World Cup," he added. "It's not...we don't have good trainers or coaches. Whether...load is too much, whether they're playing too many formats...something needs to be done," Binny said.

244.title: Bengaluru becomes 2nd Indian city to get 90-m aerial ladder platform
244.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday dedicated a 90-metre aerial ladder platform vehicle to the Bengaluru Fire Department, which would allow officials to reach high-rise buildings in emergency situations. Bengaluru became the second Indian city, after Mumbai, to have it. "Till now, the Bengaluru Fire Department had only a 50-metre ladder," said Bommai.

245.title: 19-yr-old Grandmaster Hans Niemann sues Carlsen, others for $100 mn over cheating claims
245.article_body: US' 19-year-old Grandmaster Hans Niemann has sued world chess champion Magnus Carlsen, Chess.com and others for slander and libel over cheating allegations. Niemann stated the defendants are "colluding to blacklist" him from professional chess world. The lawsuit claims the defendants have made "defamatory statements" by accusing him of cheating and the claims have resulted in him being ostracised.

246.title: Maharashtra govt decides to waive farmers' loans of over ₹964 crore
246.article_body: The Maharashtra government has decided to write off loans of over ₹964 crore taken by farmers from land development banks (LDBs) in the state. Over 34,000 farmers, who had taken loans from these banks over two decades ago, are set to benefit from the decision. It has also approved the payment of another ₹275.40 crore to employees of LDBs.

247.title: University accused of hiring 'pretty' teacher for attendance in China, reacts after criticism
247.article_body: A university in China's Henan province was widely criticised after it was accused of hiring a teacher named Zhang because of her looks to boost attendance. Refuting the allegations, the university said it "trusted her excellent teaching ability and decided to hire her". The accusations surfaced after teaching videos of Zhang, who has over 4.3 lakh TikTok followers, went viral.

248.title: US reacts after Kashmiri journalist stopped from flying to US to collect Pulitzer
248.article_body: US has reacted after Kashmiri journalist Sanna Irshad Mattoo said she wasn't allowed to board a flight from Delhi to US to collect her Pulitzer Prize. "We...are tracking these developments closely. We are committed to supporting press freedom...A shared commitment to democratic values, including the respect for the independence of the press, is a bedrock of US-India relationship," US said.

249.title: PhonePe in talks to raise funds at $12 billion valuation: Report
249.article_body: PhonePe is in talks to raise funds from General Atlantic at over $12 billion valuation, Moneycontrol reported. General Atlantic is likely to lead the funding round with $450-$500 million investment. The investment would make the Walmart-backed startup the most-valued fintech in India. This will reportedly not be a pre-IPO round as PhonePe’s public listing is 2-3 years away.

250.title: Suzlon Energy's ₹1,200-crore rights issue subscribed 1.8 times
250.article_body: Suzlon Energy, on Thursday, said that its ₹1,200-crore rights issue has been subscribed by 1.8 times. The 240 crore partly paid-up equity shares for cash were issued from October 11 to October 20. The allotment and listing formalities of the new shares on the BSE and the NSE are expected to be completed by the first week of November.

251.title: Iranian troops in Crimea helping Russia in its war on Ukraine: US
251.article_body: Iran has deployed military experts in Crimea to help Russian forces conduct attacks on Ukraine's infrastructure and civilian population with Iran-made drones, the US alleged. The US will "pursue all means" to "expose, deter and confront Iran's provision of these munitions against...Ukrainians", US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said. Russia annexed Crimea from Ukraine in 2014.

252.title: 192 private bus operators fined ₹14.96 lakh over ticket fares in Pune
252.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office fined 192 private bus operators ₹14.96 lakh in a week for increasing ticket fares. "There are clear and strict guidelines...private tourist bus operators cannot increase fares more than 1.5 times compared to Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation fares," an official said. "Action was taken for overcharging passengers and overcrowding buses," the official added.

253.title: 5 policemen assault couple who refused to share hookah in Gurugram
253.article_body: Five policemen were suspended after they allegedly assaulted an elderly couple at their house in a village in Gurugram. The incident occurred after the couple apparently refused to share their hookah with the policemen, who were in plain clothes, as they appeared to be drunk. "Two of the accused were carrying weapons and threatening [the couple]," the couple's son claimed.

254.title: Delhi woman who accused 5 men of gangrape, inserting rod filed fake case: UP Police
254.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad have said a Delhi woman's complaint alleging that five men gangraped her and inserted a rod in private parts was a "made up and fabricated case". Police stated that the case was planned to nail the five men over a land dispute. Her three friends have been arrested on the basis of their confessional statement.

255.title: B'luru Metro barricades on Outer Ring Road to be removed by Sep 2023
255.article_body: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced a schedule for the removal of barricades placed across the city owing to construction work. It said that the Metro barricades would be removed from the entire stretch of the Outer Ring Road by September 2023. Barricades on Doddenakundi-DRDO Sports Complex will be removed by February 2023, it added.

256.title: Chinese woman living as Nepali monk in Delhi arrested, police say 'she may be a spy'
256.article_body: A Chinese woman suspected of spying has been arrested from a Tibetan refugee settlement in Delhi. Her identity papers showed her name as Dolma Lama, with an address in Nepal's capital Kathmandu, the police said. The woman, whose real name is Cai Ruo, was living under the disguise of a Buddhist monk.

257.title: 4 persons hunt turtles to cook their meat in Pune; arrested
257.article_body: Four people who were allegedly hunting turtles to cook their meat have been arrested in Pune. The forest department made the arrests after they went to check the house of one of the accused and found pieces of turtles in a cooking utensil near it. The accused were arrested under different sections of the Wild Life (Protection) Act.

258.title: Delhi Police seizes 13,700 kg firecrackers in Oct, 75 cases registered
258.article_body: Delhi Police seized over 13,700 kilograms of firecrackers from October 1 to 19 and registered 75 cases for storage or sale. Police registered six cases in connection with bursting of firecrackers in October. Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai recently said that bursting firecrackers on Diwali will attract a jail term of six months and a fine of ₹200.

259.title: Ronaldo releases statement after getting dropped for Chelsea game over walkout controversy
259.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has released a statement after getting dropped for Chelsea match. Ronaldo, who stormed down the tunnel during match against Tottenham, said, "I've always tried to set...example...for...youngsters...[but] sometimes...heat of the moment gets the best of us." "This is Manchester United...and united we must stand. Soon we'll be together again," he added.

260.title: 25-yr-old man killed as vehicle hits bike in Gurugram, his friend critical
260.article_body: A 25-year-old labourer was killed while his friend was injured after the motorcycle that they were travelling on was hit by an unidentified vehicle in Gurugram, reports said. The deceased's friend is currently undergoing treatment and his condition is said to be critical. Reports said that no arrests have been made in the case as of now.

261.title: Elon Musk plans to lay off 75% of Twitter's workforce: Report
261.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has told prospective investors that he intends to lay off nearly 75% of Twitter's 7,500-member workforce, Washington Post reported citing documents. The report said that Twitter's current management planned to cut almost a quarter of the workforce, paring $800 million from company's payroll. Musk is expected to close the purchase of Twitter by October 28.

262.title: Sehwag picks Pakistan captain Babar Azam to be 2022 T20 WC's top-scorer
262.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has picked Pakistan captain Babar Azam to end up being the 2022 T20 World Cup's top-scorer. "Babar has been extraordinary...There is a sense of calmness whenever Virat Kohli bats and you get something similar when watching Babar," added Sehwag. Interestingly, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan also picked Babar to be the top-scorer in the tournament.

263.title: Robotic surgery far superior to conventional surgery: B'luru doctors
263.article_body: According to doctors in Bengaluru, robot-assisted surgery is revolutionising healthcare and is far superior to conventional surgery. "Robot-assisted surgery gives better results. Patients have less pain and they are able to get back to work early and get back to their normal lifestyle," said Dr Jagadish J Hiremath, Founder of the AASRA Group of Hospitals.

264.title: List shows areas in Bengaluru which will face power cuts today
264.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) said parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts today as the Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. The divisions which will remain affected are - Ramanagara, Whitefield, Additional East Shivajinagar division, and Tiptur. The power outages will occur for five hours between 10 am and 3 pm.

265.title: Fake policeman replaces tailor's gold worth ₹70,000 with milk packets in Mira Bhayandar
265.article_body: A man posing as a policeman robbed a 58-year-old tailor of his gold ornaments worth ₹70,000. The man told the tailor, who was walking back home, that a robbery had taken place and asked him to place the gold ornaments he wore in the man's handkerchief for safety. The tailor found empty milk packets in the handkerchief after reaching home.

266.title: Unable to get job, drunkard kidnaps sister near Mumbai; demands ransom
266.article_body: A 25-year-old man kidnapped his five-year-old cousin and demanded ransom from her family near Mumbai on Wednesday, as he was unable to get a job and wanted to fuel his alcoholism. The accused took the victim out, offering to get her sweets, but later demanded ₹1 lakh from her family to return her safe and sound, a police officer said.

267.title: Celebrate your Nayi Shuruat ki #PehliDiwali with Alekhya: Tanishq
267.article_body: Tanishq shared that it is celebrating every new beginning in its 'Nayi Shuruat ki #PehliDiwali' campaign urging everyone to rejoice in milestones with a reminder that when you celebrate your own 'nayi shuruat,' every Diwali feels like your #PehliDiwali. It unveiled the Alekhya collection inspired by the intricate art of Pichwai, available across all Tanishq stores.

268.title: Around 50 killed in anti-government protests: Chad Prime Minister
268.article_body: Around 50 people were killed and dozens were injured on Thursday in the anti-government protests in Chad, said Prime Minister Saleh Kebzabo. Violence started after protesters, who are demanding a swift transition to democratic rule, set ablaze the prime minister's party headquarters. "What happened today is an armed popular uprising...those responsible...will face justice," said Kebzabo.

269.title: Boris Johnson could be in race to replace UK PM Truss: Report
269.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson may enter the race to replace Liz Truss as the Conservative Party's leader, The Times reported. "He's (Johnson) taking soundings but is said to believe it is a matter of national interest," The Times Political Editor Steven Swinford tweeted. Liz Truss resigned on Thursday as UK Prime Minister after just 45 days in office.

270.title: AAP releases 6th list of 20 candidates for Gujarat elections
270.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday released its sixth list of 20 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. It has fielded Parvat Vagodia from Santrampur, Dinesh Munia from Dahod, Viral Panchal from Manjalpur, Mahendra Navadiya from Surat North, Sunit Gamit from Dang and Chetan Gajera from Junagadh. The party has declared 73 candidates for the elections so far.

271.title: Namibia record highest-ever 8th wicket partnership in T20 World Cup history
271.article_body: Namibia recorded the highest-ever partnership for the eighth wicket in T20 World Cup history. Ruben Trumpelmann and David Wiese shared a 70-run stand against UAE in a T20 World Cup 2022 first round match to set the record. The previous record was held by England's Moeen Ali and David Willey, who shared a 57*-run stand against Afghanistan in 2016 edition.

272.title: Ronaldo dropped from Man Utd squad for Chelsea match for storming down the tunnel
272.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has been dropped from Manchester United squad for the Premier League match against Chelsea. This comes after Ronaldo stormed down the tunnel in 90th minute against Tottenham Hotspur on Wednesday. Ronaldo, who was named as substitute, was not brought on to play against Tottenham. "Rest of the squad is fully focused on preparing for [Chelsea match]," United said.

273.title: Uganda's Ebola outbreak 'rapidly evolving': WHO official
273.article_body: The Ebola outbreak in Uganda is "rapidly evolving", a top World Health Organization (WHO) official said on Thursday. "The Ministry of Health of Uganda has shown remarkable resilience and effectiveness and (is) constantly fine-tuning a response to what is a challenging situation," WHO Regional Director for Africa Dr Matshidiso Moeti said. Uganda on September 20 had declared an Ebola outbreak.

274.title: IIT Goa project will come to reality in Sanguem: State minister
274.article_body: State minister Subhash Phal Dessai on Thursday stated that the plan to build an IIT campus in Goa will come to reality in Sanguem. Farmers have been protesting in Goa, claiming land was being acquired for the project without their consent. "Instead of protesting, people should submit their property papers and settle, if they've encroached (into government areas)," Dessai said.

275.title: Pilots flying over Pacific Ocean spot several UFOs: Report
275.article_body: UFOs are being sighted in the sky over Pacific Ocean for last two months, according to a UFO researcher. Ben Hansen, former FBI agent and host of 'UFO Witness', procured footage and air traffic control recordings of mid-air UFO sightings by pilots, reported New York Post. In one account, a former military pilot reported seeing multiple aircraft flying above him.

276.title: The Bharat Army welcomes Team India in Melbourne ahead of Pakistan match, shares video
276.article_body: The Bharat Army, the official Team India supporters' group, welcomed Team India on their arrival in Melbourne ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. The group shared a video wherein captain Rohit Sharma can be seen cutting a cake at the airport. The video also contained pictures of Team India players with members of The Bharat Army.

277.title: Schedule for Team India's December tour of Bangladesh announced
277.article_body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board on Thursday announced the schedule for India's tour of the country in December. India will arrive in Bangladesh on December 1. India will play three ODIs against Bangladesh on December 4, 7 and 10 in Dhaka. India will then play a Test match in Chattogram from December 14 and another Test in Dhaka from December 22.

278.title: BJP protests near Raj Bhavan in J'khand for OBC quota in ULB polls
278.article_body: The BJP OBC cell on Thursday staged a protest near Jharkhand's Raj Bhavan to demand reservation for Other Backward Classes in the upcoming Urban Local Body (ULB) elections in the state. Jharkhand Cabinet recently announced that ULB elections will be conducted next year without reservation for OBCs. The announcement came despite the state's nod to hike OBC reservation to 27%.

279.title: Towels soaked in liquid gold seized by customs officials at Cochin airport
279.article_body: A man was caught by customs officials at the Cochin International Airport for smuggling gold and six towels soaked in liquid gold were seized from him. The amount of gold has not yet been determined. The man had boarded the SG-54 SpiceJet flight to arrive at the Cochin International Airport.

280.title: Centre aims to raise defence sector turnover to $22 bn: Rajnath
280.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said the Centre aims to raise the turnover of India's defence production to $22 billion by 2025, which is presently $12 billion. Speaking at the Defence Expo 2022 in Gandhinagar on Thursday, Singh appealed to private players in the defence sector to invest in India. "The Indian defence industry is the sunrise sector," he said.

281.title: 6.7 magnitude earthquake hits western Panama
281.article_body: A 6.7 magnitude earthquake hit western Panama on Thursday morning. There was no initial report of damage. The tremor was felt in Herrera, Bocas Del Toro, Veraguas and western Panama, the National Civil Defense agency said. According to the US Geological Survey, the earthquake occurred 62 km south-southwest of Boca Chica off the Pacific coast.

282.title: Navjot Sidhu taken to hospital after he falls sick in Patiala jail
282.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who is lodged in Patiala Central Jail in a 1988 road rage case, was taken to a hospital for check-up after he fell sick. State Jails Minister Harjot Singh Bains said that he personally enquired about Sidhu's health. Meanwhile, CM Bhagwant Mann said Sidhu will get ample security for a hearing in a Ludhiana case.

283.title: Congress remembers Dalits only during its tough times: Mayawati
283.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party President Mayawati on Thursday said the Congress party remembers Dalits only during its tough times. The statement was made a day after Dalit leader Mallikarjun Kharge was elected as the Congress' President. "The history of Congress is a witness that they have always neglected/disdained the messiah of the downtrodden Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar and his society," Mayawati tweeted.

284.title: Kerala Congress MLA gets bail in case of rape, attempt to murder
284.article_body: A Kerala court on Thursday granted anticipatory bail to Congress MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly in a case of rape and attempt to murder. It asked Kunnappilly to surrender his passport and barred him from leaving Kerala without police's permission. He's accused of raping a 35-year-old woman on the promise of marriage and later offering her ₹30 lakh to settle the case.

285.title: EU countries agree on sanctioning Iranian officials over drones used against Ukraine
285.article_body: The European Union has agreed on sanctions to target officials in Tehran over Russia striking Ukraine with Iranian-made drones. EU official Nabila Massrali said there is evidence that suggests the drones used by Russia were from Iran. "EU states decided to freeze the assets of three individuals and one entity responsible for drone deliveries," said the Czech EU presidency.

286.title: Verventa Holdings gets CCI approval to acquire up to 10% in Yes Bank
286.article_body: Verventa Holdings, an affiliate of Advent International, has received approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to acquire equity securities of up to 10% in Yes Bank. Verventa Holdings Ltd (Acquirer) is an investment holding company. In July, Yes Bank's board had approved raising ₹8,898 crore in equity capital from Carlyle and Advent International.

287.title: Meta oversight board can apply warning screen on 'sensitive' content
287.article_body: Meta's independent oversight board can soon apply warning screen on content marking it "sensitive" or "disturbing". The board can also apply a warning screen when it is leaving up content or restoring content including photos and videos. A report from the board stated that they have received close to two million appeals from users globally in the last two years.

288.title: BJP shouldn't give excuses for failing to run MCD: Kejriwal
288.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said the BJP should not make "excuses" for its 15-year-long "failure" in running the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). Earlier, Union Home Minister Amit Shah had said Kejriwal wanted Delhi to be 'AAP Nirbhar', while the BJP aims to make it 'Atmanirbhar'. "Why should people trust you (BJP)...we will make Delhi garbage-free," Kejriwal tweeted.

289.title: All FTA talks, including with the UK, on track: Piyush Goyal
289.article_body: Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said that talks on free trade agreements (FTA) with Britain, Canada and the EU are still on track. Goyal's statement came hours after British Prime Minister Liz Truss announced her resignation just six weeks into the job. Goyal said India will "wait and watch" the situation following the change in British leadership.

290.title: In Pics: 'Farting zebra', other pics shortlisted for Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards
290.article_body: As many as 40 photographs from around the globe have been shortlisted for the 2022 Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards. These include a 'farting zebra', a 'superhero squirrel', a 'winking fox',  a 'horrified monkey' and a couple of monkeys playing doctors and nurses. Voting on the images will close on November 27 and the winners will be announced on December 8.

291.title: Villagers gherao ex-Jharkhand minister for 3 hours over land dispute
291.article_body: Around 50-100 villagers, mostly women, gheraoed Jharkhand's ex-minister Yogendra Saw for about three hours on Thursday in Ramgarh district over a land dispute, police said. The incident took place when he was passing through Melani village in his four-wheeler. Villagers alleged a boundary wall was being laid on their land on Saw's orders. Saw was rescued after police's intervention.

292.title: 4.7 kg drugs worth ₹2.3 cr seized at Chennai airport, Ethiopian held
292.article_body: Customs officials at Chennai airport seized 4.79 kg of methaqualone, a hypnotic sedative drug, worth ₹2.36 crore and an Ethiopian national was arrested in connection with the case. Acting on specific inputs, the authorities recovered the substance from the passenger on his arrival from Addis Ababa on October 18, an official release stated.

293.title: IFS officer shares pic of endangered turtle species, says 'Less than 150 left on Earth'
293.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share a rare picture of an endangered turtle species. He wrote, "These are northern river #terrapin (Batagur baska). Critically #endangered. Current population is [less] than 150 on whole planet." He added, "So effectively you are seeing something which our next generation will not able to see. Give it a thought."

294.title: US Prez tweets after Liz Truss resigns, says 'Will continue cooperation with UK govt'
294.article_body: US President Joe Biden, reacting to Liz Truss resigning as UK PM, tweeted, "I thank Prime Minister Liz Truss for her partnership on a range of issues including holding Russia accountable for its war against Ukraine." "We will continue our close cooperation with the UK government as we work together to meet the global challenges our nations face," he added.

295.title: K'taka Cabinet approves ordinance to hike reservation for SC/ST community
295.article_body: Karnataka Cabinet on Thursday approved the ordinance on hiking the reservation for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe communities from 15% to 17% and 3% to 7% respectively. "This historic decision will bring light and shine into their lives and uplift them by providing adequate opportunity in education and employment," CM Basavaraj S Bommai announced.

296.title: I know how to answer those who call JD(S) a sinking ship: Devegowda
296.article_body: Former Prime Minister and Janata Dal (Secular) President HD Devegowda on Thursday said that he knows how to answer those who call the party a sinking ship. "We all together should ensure victory of JD(S) in the upcoming Assembly elections," Devegowda said. "Befitting answer would be given to those who have taken up propaganda against the party," he added.

297.title: 43-year-old Proclaimed Offender on run for 19 years arrested from UP
297.article_body: A 43-year-old man, who was wanted in a case of attempt to murder and had been dodging police for 19 years, has been arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Deoband. Joginder Singh alias Anil alias Bhura was declared a Proclaimed Offender after he allegedly opened fire at Sanjay Duggal, who operated a computer business. Joginder had been arrested in UP in 2009.

298.title: Be it Sajid Khan or Raj Kundra, I can raise my voice against them: Sherlyn
298.article_body: After filing sexual exploitation complaint against Sajid Khan, Sherlyn Chopra said, "Be it Sajid...or Raj Kundra, if they're wrong, I can raise my voice against them." When police asked why it took so long for her to file a complaint about an incident that happened in 2005, Sherlyn said, "Back then I didn't have...courage to file...complaint against...big name like Sajid."

299.title: UP CM to inaugurate 66 development projects during Deepotsava festivities
299.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath will inaugurate 66 projects during the sixth edition of Deepotsava celebrations. The projects will focus on urban development, transport, housing, urban planning, public works, tourism and dairy development. CM Yogi Adityanath will also inaugurate the construction of a driving training institute at the cost of ₹856.84 crore.

300.title: Oil prices rise by more than $1 amid tight supplies
300.article_body: Oil prices on Thursday rose by more than $1 amid tighter supplies and on reports that China is considering easing COVID-19-related norms. While Brent crude rose $1.15 to $93.56 per barrel, US West Texas Intermediate crude for November delivery rose $1.54 to $87.09 per barrel. The WTI contract for December delivery was up 1.7%.

301.title: People are fed up with COVID-19 vaccines, I'm fed up too: Adar Poonawalla
301.article_body: Covishield vaccine maker Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla on Thursday said boosters have no demand at the moment. He added, "There is lethargy generally. People are fed up with COVID, vaccines. To be honest, I am also fed up with it." He also said that SII stopped the production of Covishield vaccine in December 2021.

302.title: Nothing to do with elections: Dera Sacha Sauda on Ram Rahim's parole
302.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda spokesperson Jitendra Khurana on Thursday said that the organisation's head Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh got parole as per the law and it has nothing to do with the upcoming Adampur by-elections in Haryana. The organisation has nothing to do with any political activity, he added. Rape convict Ram Rahim was released from jail on parole on Saturday.

303.title: 'Pardes' distributors wanted me to cast 'bigger names', not Mahima: Subhash Ghai
303.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai recently revealed that the distributors of 'Pardes' wanted him to cast 'bigger names' instead of Mahima Chaudhry and Apurva Agnihotri in the film. "My script did not allow me to cast a star for Kusum Ganga's and Rajiv's characters (played by Mahima and Apurva). I only wanted to cast actors who could fit the bill," he said.

304.title: Caller demands sensitive info from IAS officer, threatens her; FIR filed
304.article_body: A senior IAS officer has filed an FIR with Delhi Police against an unidentified person after he approached her as a senior government officer to extract sensitive material from her current department. The officer claimed she was harassed and abused by the person over past few weeks. He also warned her that police wouldn't be able to trace his location.

305.title: Airbus receives nod for programme to produce military aircraft in India
305.article_body: Airbus said it has received the regulatory approval from the Indian regulator for its C295 aircraft programme. India had sealed a nearly ₹21,000 crore deal with Airbus Defence and Space to procure 56 C295 transport aircraft. Under the deal, 40 out of the 56 aircraft will be manufactured and assembled by Tata Advanced Systems (TASL) in India.

306.title: Black Death may have fuelled rise in diabetes and arthritis: Study
306.article_body: A research based on plague corpses found in London and Denmark has found that the pandemic could have increased the rise of diabetes, arthritis and multiple sclerosis in humans. The plague, also known as Black Death, fuelled genes that make people vulnerable to autoimmune diseases. Natural selection occurred at pace in survivors, leaving their descendants at increased risk, scientists said.

307.title: Microsoft working on Xbox gaming store for mobiles: Report
307.article_body: Microsoft is reportedly working on an Xbox gaming store, competing with the Google Play Store and the Apple's App Store, according to filings. "Shifting consumers away from the Google Play Store and App Store on mobile devices will, however, require a major shift in consumer behaviour," Microsoft said. Recently, Microsoft announced it will acquire Activision Blizzard for $68.7 billion.

308.title: Maha CM, Dy CM encourage students to celebrate pollution-free Diwali
308.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday urged students to celebrate a pollution-free Diwali. Addressing an event organised at the Mantralaya, Shinde said, "For the past two years, people have been unable to celebrate Diwali due to COVID-19, but after the formation of our government...all the festivals will be celebrated with joy and enthusiasm."

309.title: Helicopter services to Kedarnath temple resume
309.article_body: Helicopter services to Kedarnath temple in Uttarakhand resumed two days after a chopper crash killed a pilot and six pilgrims. Since the services resumed, 981 pilgrims were taken to Kedarnath, officials said. Aryan Aviation, owner of the crashed helicopter, also resumed its services from Masta-Guptkashi to Kedarnath after investigation and inspection were completed, a company official said.

310.title: ITC reports 20% rise in net profit in Q2 at ₹4,466 crore
310.article_body: ITC reported a 20% year-on-year increase in post-tax profit for the quarter ended September 2022 at ₹4,466 crore. Sequentially, the profit rose 7.1% from ₹4,169 crore recorded in the previous quarter. Standalone revenue (excluding excise duty) saw an increase of 26.6% at ₹16,130 crore for the quarter, against ₹12,731 crore for the same time last year.

311.title: 4 of a family die, 5 injured as speeding vehicle rams into auto in MP
311.article_body: Four members of a family, who were travelling in an auto-rickshaw, were killed after a speeding vehicle containing oxygen cylinders rammed into it on Gwalior-Jhansi Highway on Wednesday. Five other occupants of the auto-rickshaw were grievously injured and are receiving treatment, police said. The driver of the vehicle was reportedly driving on the wrong side of the road.

312.title: Teacher slaps student for wearing 'tilak' at Haryana school; apologises
312.article_body: A government school teacher in Haryana's Yamuna Nagar allegedly slapped a student for wearing a 'tilak' to school. Following the incident, the family of the student reached the school and created a ruckus. The student's parents and a Hindu organisation protested against the behaviour of the teacher and demanded a written apology, reports said.

313.title: Puneeth Rajkumar to be posthumously given 'Karnataka Ratna' on Nov 1
313.article_body: The Karnataka government on Thursday announced that late actor Puneeth Rajkumar will be conferred with the 'Karnataka Ratna' award on November 1 for his contribution towards the art of cinema. The award will be presented at an event held in front of the Vidhana Soudha, CM Basavaraj Bommai said. The actor died due to a heart attack last year.

314.title: Australia's Inglis severely cuts hand while playing golf, replaced by Green in T20 WC squad
314.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper Josh Inglis severely cut his hand after a club snapped while he was playing golf on Wednesday. He has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup 2022 and has been replaced by Cameron Green in the squad. Australia head coach Andrew McDonald said that he has never seen an injury like the one suffered by Inglis.

315.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted Noida woman, released from jail
315.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested in August for assaulting a woman at a residential society in Noida, was released from jail on Thursday. He was granted bail by the Allahabad High Court on Monday. "He was released this (Thursday) evening after all legal formalities," Jail Superintendent Arun Pratap Singh said.

316.title: MP bus driver flashes abusive word on display board after being fired, complaint filed
316.article_body: A bus conductor allegedly changed the scrolling text on a bus' LED display board to a cuss word as revenge after being fired by his employer in MP. After videos went viral, the owner of the bus service ordered the display shut and subsequently reported the incident at Kolgawan police station in Satna. The police are investigating the matter.

317.title: Akram gets angry on live TV after fan asks why he didn't play vs India in 1996 WC
317.article_body: A video went viral showing Wasim Akram getting angry on live TV after a fan asked him why he didn't play against India in 1996 World Cup. "Never ever listen to rumours...you guys weren't even born then...It's embarrassing when Pakistanis have a go at me," he said. Akram revealed he hid injury till last moment so India wouldn't gain confidence.

318.title: 25-year-old BHU student found hanging inside hostel room, parents demand inquiry
318.article_body: A 25-year-old Banaras Hindu University (BHU) student was found hanging inside his hostel room, with his parents demanding an inquiry into his death. The student's parents stated that they had talked to him hours before he was found dead and they hadn't found anything concerning. The student was a native of Bihar's Bhojpur and was studying LLM at the university.

319.title: Stray dog beaten to death in MP; 2 booked after video of incident goes viral
319.article_body: Two persons were booked after a video showing them beating a stray dog to death in Madhya Pradesh's Indore went viral on social media. The video shows the accused continuously beating the dog with sticks. They did not stop hitting the dog even after it died. Police are conducting search operations to arrest the accused.

320.title: Infosys allows employees to take up external gig work
320.article_body: Infosys has allowed its employees to take up external gig work, Moneycontrol reported citing an e-mail sent to the employees. "Any employee, who wishes to take up gig work, may do so, with the prior consent of their manager and BP-HR, and in their personal time, for establishments that don't compete with Infosys or Infosys' clients," the e-mail said.

321.title: Haryana to allow only green crackers on Diwali: CM
321.article_body: Haryana CM ML Khattar on Thursday said there will be a complete ban on normal firecrackers on Diwali and only green crackers will be allowed. "We have to take care of the environment along with festive splendour," he added. Haryana has earmarked places for the sale of green firecrackers across the state.

322.title: 'Chaiwallah' replaces 4-time Shimla Urban seat winner as candidate for Himachal polls
322.article_body: Sanjay Sood, a tea shop owner, has replaced four-time winner from Shimla Urban, state minister Suresh Bhardwaj, as BJP's candidate for Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls. "It was my very good decision to work for BJP," Sood said. ''Surely it's strange because here is only one seat where I have been elected regularly for 32 consecutive years of politics," Bhardwaj said.

323.title: Google fined ₹1,338 crore in India for anti-competitive practices
323.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Thursday imposed a penalty of ₹1,337.76 crore on Google for abusing its dominant position in multiple markets in the Android mobile device ecosystem. The CCI directed the internet major to cease and desist from unfair business practices. The CCI said it has also directed Google to modify its conduct within a defined timeline.

324.title: Decomposed carcass of tiger found in Maha's Chandrapur forest
324.article_body: The decomposed carcass of an adult tiger was found on Thursday in Ballarpur forest division in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district, an official said. A forest guard patrolling the area within Central Chanda division spotted the tiger's body, the official added. "Preliminary investigations suggest the tiger may have died of old age," Prakash Lonkar, Chief Conservator of Forests, Chandrapur, said.

325.title: Drug smuggler held after encounter in Punjab; heroin, pistol seized
325.article_body: The Jalandhar Rural Police arrested a drug smuggler Gagandeep Singh and seized 2 kg of heroin and a pistol from him. Gagandeep, who faces charges of murder, smuggling drugs besides cases under the Arms Act, was arrested after an encounter in Moga, SSP said. "As soon as...[the police] raided his location, Gagandeep and his aide opened fire on...police," SSP added.

326.title: Nazara Technologies CEO Manish Agarwal to step down
326.article_body: Gaming and sports media platform Nazara Technologies CEO Manish Agarwal will be stepping down on December 1, 2022, the company announced. In an exchange filing, Nazara said that Manish Agarwal will continue to be associated with the company as a Nazara nominee on the boards of material subsidiaries. Nitish Mittersain, Founder of Nazara will be taking over as the CEO.

327.title: Missing Dalit girl's mutilated body found in bushes in UP's Azamgarh
327.article_body: The mutilated body of a Dalit girl was found in bushes by villagers at Majhauli village in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh district on Thursday. The girl had been missing since October 15 and her father had filed a complaint. Her body was sent for autopsy. A case was registered under the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

328.title: Was molested by a director at 18, ran away from office: Sreejita De
328.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' ex-contestant Sreejita De revealed that she was humiliated and molested by a director when she was 18. "I ran away from the office," she said, adding she had gone to the director's office to sign a film. "[A producer] told me...this guy has a reputation like this, and asked me not to meet him again," she said.

329.title: Girl mistakes exam chit as love letter, her family kills Class 5 boy in Bihar
329.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was allegedly chopped to death by the brothers of a girl, who mistook a chit he threw in  examination hall for love letter, in Bihar's Bhojpur. Police recovered the class 5 student's body parts near railway tracks. Four juveniles and adult family members were apprehended. Youths were sent to jail and juveniles were sent to remand homes.

330.title: Liz Truss catastrophically illiterate, a disgrace: Russia on UK's outgoing PM
330.article_body: Russia's foreign ministry welcomed Liz Truss' departure as Britain's PM. "Britain has never known such a disgrace of a prime minister," Russian Foreign Ministry Spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said. She said Truss would be remembered for her "catastrophic illiteracy", an apparent reference to Truss' Moscow visit when she reportedly confused two regions of Russia with Ukraine.

331.title: Gold prices fall over ₹4,000 per 10 grams from year's high of ₹54,380
331.article_body: Gold prices have reported a fall of over ₹4,000 per 10 grams from the year's high of ₹54,380 reported in April. According to rates published by India Bullion and Jewellers Association, 24-karat gold was sold at ₹50,240 per 10 grams on Wednesday. Gold price in Delhi fell ₹66 to ₹50,516 per 10 grams on Thursday, according to HDFC Securities.

332.title: Fake video shows PM Modi saying 'divide and rule is BJP's tradition'
332.article_body: A fake video has surfaced online showing Prime Minister Narendra Modi saying, "Brothers and sisters, divide and rule is our (BJP's) tradition, and unite and develop is Congress' tradition." The video has been edited and the original video is from 2014, The Quint reported. The unedited video showed PM Modi saying, "Brothers and sisters, divide and rule is Congress' tradition."

333.title: 10 kg pipe IED recovered in Chhattisgarh's Kanker
333.article_body: A 10 kg pipe improvised explosive device (IED) was recovered by security forces in Chhattisgarh's Kanker, an official said. The soldiers present at the spot defused the pipe bomb and further investigation is underway, Antagarh SDPO Amar Sidar said. A DRG team patrolling the area received information about the device being planted and rushed to the spot.

334.title: Amazon facing $1 billion lawsuit in UK for 'favouring own products'
334.article_body: Amazon is facing a UK lawsuit for damages of up to £900 million ($1 billion) over allegations that the firm abused its dominant position by favouring its own products. Consumer rights advocate Julie Hunter plans to bring the collective action on behalf of British consumers who have made purchases on Amazon since October 2016. Case is "without merit", Amazon said.

335.title: Four killed in an explosion in a house in Madhya Pradesh
335.article_body: Four people, including three of a family, were killed and seven others were injured in an explosion in a house in Banmore town, Madhya Pradesh, on Thursday. The house collapsed after the blast. While some crackers were found in the house's godown, the quantity was not enough to be certain it caused the blast, an official said.

336.title: Depriving Ganguly to fight ICC elections shameless political vendetta: Mamata
336.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday called Sourav Ganguly not getting support from BCCI for the ICC chief's election a "shameless political vendetta". Banerjee said that the move was made to secure someone else's interests, adding that she spoke to several BJP leaders, but Ganguly wasn't allowed. Banerjee had previously sought PM Modi's intervention.

337.title: Aap Cong ki girawat par dhyan do: BJP as Kharge tweets on falling rupee
337.article_body: After newly elected Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge tweeted about rupee depreciation, BJP's Amit Malviya said, "Aap Congress ki girawat par dhyan do, jo desh mein lagbhag simat chuki hain (You focus on downfall of Congress, which has almost come to a standstill in the country)." Malviya said the government and RBI are taking "appropriate steps" to address the falling rupee.

338.title: Philippines should honour helicopters' purchase deal: Russian Ambassador
338.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to the Philippines Marat Pavlov said Manila should honour the contract of buying 16 Russian-made military helicopters, amidst reports that former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte had cancelled the deal fearing US sanctions. Pavlov said the Philippine government has not notified Russia of the cancellation. He said a Russian company has begun manufacturing the helicopters.

339.title: Assam govt withdraws AFSPA from West Karbi Anglong district
339.article_body: The Assam government has removed the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act from one more district, West Karbi Anglong, with effect from October 1. The Act still covers eight districts bordering Arunachal Pradesh and Nagaland and a sub-division bordering Manipur. The eight districts are Tinsukia, Dibrugarh, Charaideo, Sivasagar, Jorhat, Golaghat, Karbi Anglong and Dima Hasao.

340.title: BJP, TRS trying to create WB-like situation in T'gana: Cong's Revanth Reddy
340.article_body: Telangana Congress chief A Revanth Reddy on Wednesday claimed that BJP and TRS were conspiring to do a similar experiment in Telangana, which was conducted in West Bengal, by resorting to violence in Munugode constituency. Reddy claimed that CM K Chandrashekar Rao is planning to visit Munugode with a massive convoy and there is possibility of unrest after his visit.

341.title: US startup's flying car gets $3 mn from Tesla investor
341.article_body: California-based Alef Aeronautics, which makes flying cars, has attracted prominent venture capitalist Tim Draper. Draper, an early investor in Tesla and SpaceX, has invested $3 million in Alef through his Draper Associates Fund V. Jim Dukhovny, Founder of Alef Aeronautics, said he put more money in after Draper's investment and after seeing a small drone prototype.

342.title: Bengaluru IPS officer Nisha James transferred following allegations of harassment
342.article_body: IPS officer Nisha James has been transferred, days after police personnel in Bengaluru alleged she was harassing them, officials said on Thursday. James, who was Deputy Commissioner of Police, Administration, Bengaluru City Police, has been made Superintendent of Police, Internal Security Division. Senior police officers said a departmental inquiry will be initiated in the matter.

343.title: JeM chief Masood Azhar charged in J&K terror attack before PM's visit
343.article_body: The NIA on Wednesday filed a chargesheet against Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) chief Maulana Masood Azhar, his brother Rouf Asghar Alvi and 10 others in the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Sunjuwan in April 2022. The attack took place two days before PM Narendra Modi's visit to Jammu. The NIA said JeM terrorists had infiltrated into India for disrupting PM's visit.

344.title: House in Bihar washes away in Ganga due to erosion; video surfaces
344.article_body: A video of a house in Bihar's Bhagalpur getting washed away in Ganga river due to erosion has surfaced online. "If there's damage to house due to erosion, we'll provide financial help to repair the house to concerned beneficiaries after getting the records approved," District Magistrate SK Sen said. Several houses have reportedly been washed away in past few days.

345.title: JP Nadda to chair Rajasthan BJP core committee meeting on Friday
345.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda will hold Rajasthan BJP core committee meeting in Delhi on Friday to discuss about the preparations for the upcoming 2023 Assembly elections. Union Ministers from Rajasthan, Rajasthan BJP President Satish Poonia, Leader of the Opposition in Rajasthan Assembly Gulab Chand Kataria will be present in the meeting. State leaders will give feedback about the current situation.

346.title: LIC to recover its investment in IDBI Bank by time of sale: Official
346.article_body: An official said LIC is expected to recover the ₹21,624 crore it invested in IDBI Bank. The official claimed that share prices will likely rebound to 2019 levels by the time the lender is privatised. According to the official, IDBI's share price has jumped from ₹35 a share to ₹45 a piece, since the privatisation process started.

347.title: Candle light march in Noida after infant mauled to death by stray dog
347.article_body: Residents of a housing society in Noida's sector 100 carried out a candle march protest on Wednesday night after a seven-month-old child was mauled to death by a stray dog at an apartment building.
