The angry residents protested against the authorities for failing to provide shelters for stray dogs. "We cannot leave our children to die," a resident said.

348.title: Axis Bank reports 70% YoY increase in Q2 net profit at ₹5,330 crore
348.article_body: Axis Bank reported a 70% year-on-year (YoY) rise in its net profit to reach ₹5,329.77 crore for quarter ending September 2022. Net profit grew 29% quarter-on-quarter, while net interest income (NII) went up by 31% YoY to ₹10,360.3 crore. Its provisions stood at ₹549.78 crore in Q2 FY23, which is a fall of 68% from ₹1,735 crore in Q2 FY22.

349.title: Video shows NCP's Supriya Sule exiting car to clear traffic in Pune
349.article_body: A video has gone viral on the internet, showing NCP leader Supriya Sule exiting her car to clear traffic in Pune. In the video, Sule can be seen guiding the drivers to make way for clearing the traffic in Hadapsar. "Top priority should be given to Palkhi Highway from Hadapsar to Saswad," she said in a tweet.

350.title: Was replaced in 'Saaya' just after 1 shot, thought my life was over: Katrina
350.article_body: Katrina Kaif revealed that she was replaced in Anurag Basu's film 'Saaya' just after shooting one shot. "Not one day but just one shot...at that time I thought...my life was over...my career was over," Katrina said. "I've had people, to my face, say when I first started out that you cannot be an actor...there's nothing good about you," she added.

351.title: BBMP considers terminating contract of pothole filling agency
351.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) officials said they are considering terminating American Road Technology and Solutions' contract as the civic body's pothole filling agency. The development comes after a woman died earlier in the week in an accident on a pothole-riddled road in the city. "We have issued two notices to the company," said BBMP Chief Engineer (Projects) M Lokesh.

352.title: PhonePe is investing $200 million on data centres: Co-founder Rahul Chari
352.article_body: PhonePe's Co-founder and Chief Technology Officer Rahul Chari said the company is investing $200 million on building data centres in India. He added that the investments are driven by the regulatory insistence on data localisation. He said the company has already invested $150 million but did not specify a timeline for investing the remaining $50 million.

353.title: Mumbai student cheated of ₹44,200 after ordering 30,000 eggs for business
353.article_body: A 22-year-old commerce student was allegedly cheated of ₹44,200 in Mumbai. Ajay Gupta found the accused, Gurmeet Singh, on Justdial in September 2021 and ordered 30,000 eggs from him for his wholesale business. He had paid him ₹44,200. Later, Singh asked him to pay ₹42,750 more for 'insurance'. When Gupta refused and asked for a refund, Singh declined his request.

354.title: Not just future of Shiv Sena, but Indian democracy at stake: Uddhav
354.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that not only the future of the Shiv Sena but democracy in India is at stake. He is fighting a legal battle over the legacy of the party founded by his father late Bal Thackeray. "My future and that of my party will be decided by the people and the party cadre," Uddhav said.

355.title: 4 police officers torture soldier, his brother over fake case in Kerala; suspended
355.article_body: A total of four policemen in Kerala's Kollam were suspended on Thursday on charges of torturing two brothers, including a soldier, after fabricating a case against them. The alleged torture came to light after the 30-year-old and 25-year-old brothers were released from judicial custody. "When we pleaded for water, they asked us to drink urine," one of the brothers said.

356.title: 1 face before us, 1 before media: Mistry on Tharoor over 'irregularities' claim
356.article_body: Congress' Central Election Authority chief Madhusudan Mistry criticised Shashi Tharoor over his allegations of "irregularities" remark, saying that he had "one face before us and another before the media". "We accommodated your request and despite that, you went to the media alleging the Central Election Authority was conspiring against you," Mistry said.

357.title: Coal import to be stopped by 2024: Coal Minister
357.article_body: Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said that the import of coal, which has declined considerably, will be stopped by 2024. Speaking at an event to release a 'Compendium of Asset Accounts on Mineral and Energy Resources', the minister said the report presents comprehensive picture of the mineral resources spread across different states in the country.

358.title: People put AC on 17°C and use a blanket: PM while speaking on climate change
358.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while speaking on climate change, stressed that "climate change goes beyond policy making". He said, "Some people prefer to keep the air conditioner's temperature at 17°C or 18°C and these same people then use a blanket too." He added that with each dropping temperature, the energy consumption increases and the adverse effect on the environment also increases.

359.title: Celebrity engagement firm Tring raises $5 mn in pre-Series A round
359.article_body: Celebrity engagement platform Tring raised $5 million in a pre-Series A funding round led by Kalaari Capital and saw participation from Blume Founders Fund, Redbrook Pte (Singapore) and Sujeet Kumar (Udaan.com). Kalaari Capital invested $2 million and has an option to invest $2.5 million later. Tring was founded by Akshay Saini, Rahul Saini and Pranav Chabhadia to improve celebrity-fan engagement.

360.title: Foxconn delays Bharat FIH's IPO due to current market conditions
360.article_body: Foxconn Technology Group said it has decided to push the plans for floating ₹5,000 crore IPO for the India unit Bharat FIH forward in light of the market conditions. Foxconn said a proposed spinoff would be pursued when conditions improve. Bharat FIH, a subsidiary of FIH Mobiles and a Foxconn Technology Group company, makes devices for Xiaomi and Nokia.

361.title: Who are India's top 10 philanthropists according to Hurun?
361.article_body: HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar & family have topped Hurun India Philanthropy List 2022 with donations totalling ₹1,161 crore. They're followed by Wipro's Azim Premji & family with ₹484 crore in donations. The Premji family is followed by Mukesh Ambani & family. Kumar Mangalam Birla & family were ranked 4th, followed by Susmita and Subroto Bagchi and Radha & NS Parthasarathy.

362.title: China holds emergency talks with chip firms over US curbs: Report
362.article_body: Chinese government convened emergency meetings over the past week with leading semiconductor firms, seeking to assess the damage from US' newly-imposed chip sanctions, according to reports. Executives from firms like Yangtze Memory Technologies and Dawning Information Industry were summoned to attend the closed-door meetings. Many executives said the sanctions will be disastrous for the industry.

363.title: US-based Tribe Capital to invest $2 bn in Indian startups in 2 years
363.article_body: US-headquartered venture capital firm Tribe Capital will invest $2 billion across Indian startups in the next two years. Founded in 2018, the firm has three venture capital funds, along with two funds investing in crypto and token-based opportunities. CEO and Co-founder Arjun Sethi said, "Currently, we have $1.5 billion Assets Under Management (AUM) of which 20% is in India."

364.title: Girl mistakes exam chit as love letter, her family kills Class 5 boy in Bihar
364.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was reportedly chopped to death by a girl's family after she mistook his exam 'chit' as love letter in Bihar. Narrating the incident, police said, "The boy threw a chit at his sister to help her...However, the chit fell near another girl...who thought it to be a love letter. After...exam, she conveyed the message to her brothers."

365.title: Gangster Atiq Ahmad calls UP CM Adityanath 'brave'; video surfaces
365.article_body: A video showing gangster Atiq Ahmad praising Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has surfaced online. In the video, Ahmad can be seen saying, "Yogi Adityanath ek imaandaar mukhyamantri hain aur bohot bahadur hain (Yogi Adityanath is an honest and very brave CM)." Ahmad said this while he was being taken to a CBI court in Lucknow for a hearing.

366.title: UK Prime Minister Liz Truss resigns after 45 days in office
366.article_body: Liz Truss has resigned as UK Prime Minister after 45 days in office amid massive economic crisis, becoming the shortest-serving leader in British history. Conservatives will choose a new UK leader within a week, Truss said in her resignation statement. She had defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race.

367.title: 'No shame...read history: Gehlot to BJP over 'rubber stamp' remark on Kharge
367.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot criticised BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore over his "rubber stamp" remark on Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge and said that the party should "read history". Gehlot said that BJP leaders have "no shame". Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij on Wednesday said that Congress Presidential polls were elections for "Gandhi family's remote".

368.title: Choose between AAP-nirbhar or Atmanirbhar: Shah ahead of Delhi MCD polls
368.article_body: Ahead of the Delhi MCD polls, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that people will have to decide if they want to be "AAP-nirbhar or Atmanirbhar". "People should also decide if they like 'prachaar' (campaign) politics or 'parivartan' (change) politics," Shah added. He accused the Kejriwal government of "step-motherly treatment" to civic bodies and said it owed them ₹40,000 crore.

369.title: MP man kills neighbour for interfering in fight with his wife over 'mutton'
369.article_body: A man killed his 45-year-old neighbour for interfering in a fight with his wife over cooking 'mutton' in MP on Tuesday. The accused had purchased meat and had plans of cooking it, however, his wife objected to it, saying it was a Tuesday. The deceased intervened after hearing noises, following which the accused hit him with a heavy stick.

370.title: SEBI clears Centre's proposal to turn Vodafone Idea dues into equity: Report
370.article_body: Market regulator SEBI has cleared Centre's proposal to convert Vodafone Idea's (Vi) dues of over $1.92 billion into equity, Reuters reported. SEBI has also approved Centre's request to classify its shareholding in the telecom operator as public float and has communicated its decisions to the telecom ministry. Centre's stake in Vi after the conversion could be over 30%.

371.title: Bombay HC issues notice to PMC over PIL on water scarcity in Pune
371.article_body: The Bombay High Court issued a notice to nine government organisations, including the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), over a petition filed about water scarcity in the city. Justices SV Gangapurwala and RN Laddha heard the PIL filed by residents of urban areas of Pune. Petitioners alleged that all the dams and reservoirs are 100% full yet water doesn't reach residents.

372.title: Pune civic body to make management reports for roads in the city
372.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will appoint a technical consultant to prepare maintenance management reports for the city roads. "The PMC will carry out inspection of all roads with width above 12 metre in the city limits," a civic body official said. The parameters for inspection will include pothole areas, pothole depth, pavement conditions among other things, the official added.

373.title: Our biggest achievement: Kejriwal as PM Modi visits school in Guj
373.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi visited a government school in Gujarat, Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said, "This is our biggest achievement." "I'm...very happy that today all the parties...have to talk about education and schools...I hope that education is not missed only during elections," Kejriwal added. He also shared a picture of PM Modi sitting in a classroom.

374.title: Rachakonda Police bust cricket betting racket, 4 persons arrested
374.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police busted a cricket betting racket and arrested four persons in connection with the case. The police seized ₹6 lakh in cash, four mobile phones, along with frozen amount of ₹10.71 lakh in two ICICI bank accounts belonging to two of the accused. The bookie, Uddaraju Sathish Raju, is currently absconding, police stated.

375.title: Over 28,000 kg fake cumin made from stone powder seized in Delhi
375.article_body: Delhi Police's Crime Branch has seized over 28,000 kilograms of fake cumin in an illegal factory in Delhi's Rohini. Police have arrested Suresh Gupta, the owner of the factory. According to police, fake cumin is made using wild grass, jaggery vinegar and stone powder and then these fake seeds are mixed with the real ones and sold in the market.

376.title: UAE win a match in T20 World Cup for the first time in history
376.article_body: UAE defeated Namibia by seven runs in their last Group A first round match of T20 World Cup 2022. It's UAE's first-ever victory in T20 World Cup history. Despite their win, UAE finished last on Group A points table. Namibia and UAE have been eliminated from the tournament. Sri Lanka and Netherlands have advanced to Super 12s from Group A.

377.title: Voting direction clear: Cong on Rahul declaring party chief before results
377.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said "erroneous" reports claimed that Congress MP Rahul Gandhi announced Mallikarjun Kharge as the new party President before the result of the party election was out. "The direction of voting was quite clear," he added. At a press conference on Wednesday, Rahul had said, "I can't comment on the Congress President's role, that's for...Kharge...to comment on."

378.title: Delhivery's stock drops by 14% on moderate shipment growth concerns
378.article_body: After logistics company Delhivery said it expects moderate growth of shipment volumes for the rest of FY23 due to high inflation and the average user spending, its stock dropped 14% to ₹479 apiece on BSE on Thursday. Its guidance on flat festive sales and moderate growth in FY23 is expected to have an impact on the broader e-commerce segment's outlook.

379.title: Police officer accidentally shoots mobile shop worker in Punjab, video goes viral
379.article_body: A youth working in a mobile shop in Punjab's Amritsar got injured in an alleged accidental firing by a policeman. "The accused police official has been suspended. We've recovered the CCTV footage," said Varinder Singh, ACP North, Amritsar. He further said that necessary action will be taken as per the statements of the eyewitnesses and the family.

380.title: 6 dacoits barge into house, hold family hostage; loot 40 tola gold, 3 kg silver
380.article_body: Around six dacoits looted 40 tola gold, 3 kg silver and ₹57,000 in cash after they barged into a house with weapons in Rajasthan's Bundi and took the family hostage. The dacoits climbed up on the house's roof and broke the grills before storming into the house. While leaving, they threatened to kill the family if they informed the police.

381.title: Rubber stamp: BJP’s Rajyavardhan Rathore on newly elected Cong chief
381.article_body: After Mallikarjun Kharge won the Congress Presidential poll, BJP leader Rajyavardhan Rathore on Wednesday said after a long period of time, the Congress party is looking away from one family but still it chose a "rubber stamp". "A strong Opposition is required for a strong democracy...Their internal election is just a fraud and drama," he stated.

382.title: Husband held for killing wife, stuffing naked body in a suitcase in Gurugram
382.article_body: Two days after a woman's naked body was found stuffed in a suitcase near Gurugram's IFFCO Chowk, police on Wednesday said her husband had been arrested for allegedly murdering her after a fight. "After killing her, he cut a part of her skin from her right forearm, which had his name tattooed, to avoid being identified," a police officer said.

383.title: Teacher beaten by women with shoes for molesting girls in UP; video surfaces
383.article_body: A government school teacher was beaten up by women with slippers and shoes in UP for allegedly molesting girls. A video of the teacher being assaulted by the girls' parents is going viral on social media. In the video, the school authorities can be seen trying to defuse the situation and guarding the teacher against being subjected to violence.

384.title: He was okay with me: Sreejita De on Sajid Khan's participation in 'BB 16'
384.article_body: Actress Sreejita De, the first contestant who was eliminated from 'Bigg Boss 16', opened up about #MeToo accused Sajid Khan's participation in the show and said he was okay with her and everybody else. "If he would have done something unacceptable, the makers would've thrown him out immediately," Sreejita, who shared a cordial bond with Sajid on the show, said.

385.title: Bank worker, wife cheat ex-Lok Sabha official of over ₹1 cr on pretext of investments
385.article_body: A retired deputy director of security at the Lok Sabha was allegedly cheated of over ₹1 crore by an Axis Bank employee and his wife on the pretext of investments in mutual funds and shares. The 83-year-old retired official knew the accused since 2013 and the latter had been sharing fake documents of investments with him.

386.title: Russian lawmaker calls for ban on WhatsApp for state employees
386.article_body: A Russian lawmaker has called for a ban on the use of WhatsApp for official purposes, seeking promotion of domestically produced software. "Whether it is a Russian alternative or from Dubai...the main thing is...it does not belong to a company that...participates in the information war," Anton Gorelkin said. Russia recently added Meta to its "terrorists and extremists" list, Interfax reported.

387.title: Unity is most significant factor in fight against climate change: PM Modi
387.article_body: PM Narendra Modi at the global launch of 'Mission LiFE' in Gujarat on Thursday said the most significant factor in the fight against climate change is "unity". "A perception was created...climate change is merely a policy-related issue and that either governments or international institutions will take steps regarding it...Now people are feeling the effects of climate change," he said.

388.title: Madagascar minister fired for voting against annexation of Ukrainian regions
388.article_body: Madagascar's President has fired the country's Foreign Minister Richard Randriamandrato for voting at the UN to condemn Russia-backed referendums to annex four Ukrainian regions. Last week, 143 out of 193 members at UNGA voted to condemn Russia's attempts to annex four regions in Ukraine, Madagascar being one of them. Until last week, Madagascar supported neutrality and non-alignment.

389.title: EV financing startup Revfin raises $10 million in Series A round
389.article_body: Electric vehicle financing platform Revfin has secured $10 million in a Series A funding round in a combination of equity and debt. The funding round was led by a climate investments-focused venture capital fund Green Frontier Capital, LC Nueva Investment Partners and existing investors. The company's total funding has reached $25 million. Revfin was founded in 2018 by Sameer Aggarwal.

390.title: Panic among commuters after AC in Virar-bound local stops working
390.article_body: The AC in a Virar-bound local in Mumbai stopped working during peak hours on October 18 due to technical issues causing major inconvenience and panic among commuters. Some passengers experienced suffocation due to the overcrowded train. They got down at Borivali station, demanding the snag be fixed at the earliest. A video of the incident has surfaced on social media.

391.title: Court directs Hyd construction company to pay ₹25,000 to residents
391.article_body: Telangana State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has directed SLN Constructions to pay ₹25,000 to Mayuri Meadows Resident Owners Welfare Association in Hyderabad. The decision comes after the residents complained that the company deviated from the commitments it made earlier regarding infrastructure work. The company has been given deadline of two months to complete the work.

392.title: 2 held for railway diesel theft, 700 litres diesel recovered in Mumbai
392.article_body: Two persons were arrested on Wednesday for alleged diesel theft from railway premises in Mumbai and 700 litres of diesel was recovered from them. The railways stock diesel for operating water pumps used to flush out water. "Our crime prevention team got the lead regarding this case and a trap was laid accordingly, leading to the...arrest," an RPF official said.

393.title: What is Australia's 'extra fielders' strategy to avoid slow over-rate penalty at T20 WC?
393.article_body: To avoid field restriction penalty if overs aren't bowled in time during their T20 World Cup 2022 matches, Australia will deploy 'extra fielders' strategy. As per Ashton Agar, the players on the bench will be stationed all around the boundary rope to fetch ball and get it into play quickly, especially during powerplay. Agar stated it'll "potentially" save them time.

394.title: At first I could not even walk: Shaheen on recovery after knee injury in July
394.article_body: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi, in a video shared by PCB on Twitter over his knee injury, revealed that he couldn't even walk after picking up the injury in a Test against Sri Lanka in July. "I used to experience pain but took things slowly...[and] regained fitness," he added. Shaheen registered figures of 2/29 in their warm-up match against Afghanistan.

395.title: BMC starts reconstruction of 135-yr-old Malabar Hill water reservoir
395.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has taken up reconstruction work of a 135-year-old water reservoir at Malabar Hill to increase water supply. "The population level and overall demography of south Mumbai has changed drastically...which...has led to a rise in demand in daily water supply," an official said. The capacity of the tank is around 150 Million Litres per Day (MLD).

396.title: Let people breathe: SC rejects urgent hearing of plea on crackers' ban
396.article_body: Supreme Court has rejected a petition seeking an urgent hearing of a plea that challenged the complete ban on the sale and use of all kinds of firecrackers in Delhi. "Let people breathe clean air...spend your money on sweets," the Supreme Court said. Earlier, Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai had said purchasing and bursting firecrackers would be punishable in Delhi.

397.title: Iceland Cricket offers to host Asia Cup, says 'Arctic can offer BCCI what Asia cannot'
397.article_body: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah stated India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023, Iceland Cricket offered to host the tournament. "Needless to say...our offer last month to host a neutral Test series between Pakistan and India fell on deaf ears...We're happy to bestow the same offer for Asia Cup...Arctic can offer @bcci what Asia cannot," Iceland Cricket tweeted.

398.title: Gang of 4 arrested for looting cash & gold worth ₹1.5 cr from J’khand bank
398.article_body: Four members of an inter-state gang involved in looting gold jewellery and cash worth around ₹1.50 crore from a nationalised bank in Jharkhand’s Jamshedpur in August were arrested from Patna, police said. The arrests were made while they were trying to go to Nepal on Tuesday. A special police team was formed to identify and apprehend the criminals.

399.title: Cyberabad Police rescue 3 persons trapped on waterlogged road, share video
399.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Wednesday rescued three persons who were trapped on a waterlogged road stretch at Shamshabad. According to police, a truck driver and two labourers removed the barricade placed on the service road near Outer Ring Road Exit No 15, where the truck stopped. With the help of ropes, traffic head constable and patrol vehicle constables rescued them.

400.title: Woman carrying gold worth ₹17.5 lakh in her bra padding detained at B'luru airport
400.article_body: Bengaluru Customs officials detained a woman carrying gold worth ₹17.5 lakh in the padding of a bra at Kempegowda International Airport. As per a report, the officers profiling at the arrival bay observed something peculiar about the woman's posture, following which she was approached and questioned. The gold was concealed in form of paste in the bra padding.
